tool.name: Biobox add taxid
tool.description: Add taxid output from BAT or GTDB to biobox binning data
tool.command:
mkdir -p input &&
ln -s '${biobox_file}' '$biobox_file.element_identifier' &&
#for $i, $f in enumerate($input): ln -s '$f' 'input/${i}.tsv' && #end for
biobox_add_taxid.py '$biobox_file.element_identifier' '$tool_type.is_select' 'input' #if $tool_type.is_select == 'GTDB': -g '$gtdb_to_taxdump' -t '$taxonkit' -c $column #end if &&
#if $tool_type.is_select == 'GTDB': cp *_add_taxid_GTDB* $output #else: cp *_add_taxid_BAT* $output #end if

param.name: biobox_file
param.label: CAMI amber biobox file input
param.help: Input the CAMI amber biobox file here which are corespond with the biner and the BAT/GTDB output which did used the biner as input!

param.name: input
param.label: Input BAT(bin2classifier) file(s) or GTDB(Summary) file(s) here
param.help: Input the BAT or GTDB output here which are corespoding with the CAMI amber biobox file(the should use the same biner output as input)

param.name: is_select
param.label: Select the tool which output should be used here
param.help: Select BAT when you use the bin2classifier file(s) or select GTDB when using the summary file(s)

param.label: Input the output from gtdb_to_taxdump here
param.help: Use the output from gtdb_to_taxdump here since we need the mapped names from GTDB to NCBI to get the arcoding taxids from NCBI

param.label: Input the output from Taxonkit here
param.help: Use the output from Taxonkit here since the need the mapped NCBI names to the arcording taxids

param.label: Input the colum with the NCBI names

tool.help:
**USAGE OF THIS TOOL**
This tool was desgin for using the BAT/GTDB-Tk output to expand the CAMI amber biobox file with the taxid column to access taxa evaluation with amber!
**IMPORTAND NOTE WHEN USING GTDB OUTPUT**
Befor using GTDB-Tk output you have to use 2 other tools to map the GTDB names to the NCBI names and then map the NCBI names to there taxids. To map the GTDB names to the NCBI names you extract the GTDB names from the summary file and with them you can now use the gtdb_to_taxdum tool! After using the gtdb_to_taxdum tool you have the extract the NCBI names here and then use the tool Taxonkit[name2taxid] to finaly get the taxids.
**INPUTS** - The CAMI amber biobox file - BAT[bin2classifier] file(s) OR GTDB-Tk[Summary] file(s) - The gtdb_to_taxdum output[WHEN USING GTDB-Tk] - The Taxonkit[name2taxid] output[WHEN USING GTDB-Tk]
**OUTPUT**
A CAMI amber biobox file with a taxid colum
